functions.name: Govern
functions.description: The Govern function provides organizational cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy.

categories.name: Organizational Context
categories.description: Organizational Context category for Govern function.

subcategories.description: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity—including privacy and civil liberties obligations—are understood and managed
The organization's role in the supply chain is understood and communicated
Critical infrastructure dependencies and critical dependencies for essential services are identified and prioritized
The organization's cybersecurity priorities and risk appetite are communicated

categories.name: Risk Management Strategy
categories.description: Risk Management Strategy category for Govern function.

subcategories.description: Organizational cybersecurity risk management strategy is established
Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed
The organization's determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector specific risk analysis
Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

categories.name: Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities
categories.description: Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities category for Govern function.

subcategories.description: Organizational leadership is responsible for cybersecurity governance
Roles and responsibilities for cybersecurity risk management are assigned and communicated
Authorities for cybersecurity decision-making are delegated appropriately

categories.name: Policy
categories.description: Policy category for Govern function.

subcategories.description: Cybersecurity policies are developed and maintained
Policies are communicated to all relevant stakeholders

categories.name: Oversight
categories.description: Oversight category for Govern function.

subcategories.description: Cybersecurity risk management strategy outcomes are reviewed to inform and adjust strategy and direction
Cybersecurity risk management strategy is reviewed and adjusted to address changes to the organization, threats, technologies, and business/mission objectives
Cybersecurity risk management strategy is reviewed and adjusted to address changes to the organization, threats, technologies, and business/mission objectives

categories.name: Supply Chain Risk Management
categories.description: Supply Chain Risk Management category for Govern function.

subcategories.description: Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
Suppliers and third-party partners of information systems, components, and services are identified, prioritized, and assessed using a cyber supply chain risk assessment process
Contracts with suppliers and third-party partners are used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of an organization's cybersecurity program
Plans and procedures are developed and implemented to maintain or restore the supply of critical products/services at acceptable levels of risk
Supply chain risk management plans, procedures, and processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
Plans and procedures are developed and implemented to maintain or restore the supply of critical products/services at acceptable levels of risk
Supply chain risk management plans, procedures, and processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
Plans and procedures are developed and implemented to maintain or restore the supply of critical products/services at acceptable levels of risk
Supply chain risk management plans, procedures, and processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
Plans and procedures are developed and implemented to maintain or restore the supply of critical products/services at acceptable levels of risk

functions.name: Identify
functions.description: The Identify function develops an organizational understanding to manage cybersecurity risk to systems, assets, data, and capabilities.

categories.name: Asset Management
categories.description: Asset Management category for Identify function.

subcategories.description: Physical devices and systems within the organization are inventoried
Software platforms and applications within the organization are inventoried
Organizational communication and data flows are mapped
External information systems are catalogued
Resources (hardware, devices, data, time, and software) are prioritized based on their classification, criticality, and business value
Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for the entire workforce and third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) are established

categories.name: Business Environment
categories.description: The organization's mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.

subcategories.description: The organization's role in the supply chain is identified and communicated
The organization's place in critical infrastructure and its industry sector is identified and communicated
Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated
Dependencies and critical functions for delivery of critical services are established
Resilience requirements to support delivery of critical services are established

categories.name: Risk Assessment
categories.description: Risk Assessment category for Identify function.

subcategories.description: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented
Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources
Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented
Potential business impacts and likelihoods are identified
Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to determine risk
Risk responses are identified and prioritized

categories.name: Improvement
categories.description: Improvement category for Identify function.

subcategories.description: Cybersecurity risk management program is improved by incorporating lessons learned and best practices
Cybersecurity risk management program is improved by incorporating lessons learned and best practices

functions.name: Protect
functions.description: The Protect function outlines appropriate safeguards to ensure delivery of critical infrastructure services.

categories.name: Identity Management and Access Control
categories.description: Identity Management and Access Control category for Protect function.

subcategories.description: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users and processes
Physical access to assets is managed and protected
Remote access is managed
Access permissions and authorizations are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties

categories.name: Awareness and Training
categories.description: Awareness and Training category for Protect function.

subcategories.description: All users are informed and trained
Privileged users understand their roles and responsibilities
Third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) understand their roles and responsibilities
Senior executives understand their roles and responsibilities
Physical and cybersecurity personnel understand their roles and responsibilities

categories.name: Data Security
categories.description: Data Security category for Protect function.

subcategories.description: Data-at-rest is protected
Data-in-transit is protected
Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition
Adequate capacity to ensure availability is maintained
Protections against data leaks are implemented
Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify software, firmware, and information integrity
The development and testing environment(s) are separate from the production environment
Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify hardware integrity

functions.name: Detect
functions.description: The Detect function defines the appropriate activities to identify the occurrence of a cybersecurity event.

categories.name: Anomalies and Events
categories.description: Anomalies and Events category for Detect function.

subcategories.description: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems is established and managed
Detected events are analyzed to understand attack targets and methods
Event data are collected and correlated from multiple sources and sensors
Impact of events is determined
Incident alert thresholds are established

categories.name: Security Continuous Monitoring
categories.description: Security Continuous Monitoring category for Detect function.

subcategories.description: The network is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
The physical environment is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
Personnel activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
Malicious code is detected
Unauthorized mobile code is detected
External service provider activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed
Vulnerability scans are performed

functions.name: Respond
functions.description: The Respond function includes appropriate activities to take action regarding a detected cybersecurity incident.

categories.name: Response Planning
categories.description: Response Planning category for Respond function.

subcategories.description: Response plan is executed during or after an incident
Response plans incorporate lessons learned
Incident response is tested
Incident response plans incorporate lessons learned

categories.name: Communications
categories.description: Communications category for Respond function.

subcategories.description: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed
Incidents are reported consistent with established criteria
Information is shared consistent with response plans
Coordination with stakeholders occurs consistent with response plans
Voluntary information sharing occurs with external stakeholders to achieve broader cybersecurity situational awareness

categories.name: Analysis
categories.description: Analysis category for Respond function.

subcategories.description: Notifications from detection systems are investigated
The impact of the incident is understood
Incidents are categorized consistent with response plans
Processes are established to receive, analyze and respond to vulnerabilities disclosed to the organization from internal and external sources
Forensics are performed

categories.name: Mitigation
categories.description: Mitigation category for Respond function.

subcategories.description: Incidents are contained
Incidents are mitigated
Incidents are resolved
Newly identified vulnerabilities are mitigated or documented as accepted risks

functions.name: Recover
functions.description: The Recover function identifies appropriate activities to maintain plans for resilience and to restore any capabilities or services that were impaired due to a cybersecurity incident.

categories.name: Recovery Planning
categories.description: Recovery Planning category for Recover function.

subcategories.description: Recovery plan is executed during or after a cybersecurity incident
Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned
Recovery plans incorporate information obtained from dependencies and third-party stakeholders
The integrity of backups and other restoration assets is verified before using them for restoration
Critical mission functions and cybersecurity risk management are considered to establish post-incident operational norms
The end of incident recovery is declared based on criteria, and incident-related documentation is completed

categories.name: Improvements
categories.description: Improvements category for Recover function.

subcategories.description: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned
Recovery strategies are updated
Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned

categories.name: Communications
categories.description: Communications category for Recover function.

subcategories.description: Public relations are managed
Reputation is repaired after an incident
Public updates on incident recovery are shared using approved methods and messaging
Recovery activities and progress in restoring operational capabilities are communicated to designated stakeholders
